args:
The city of Saint Lotier was carved from the
sapphire bosom of the mother sea, its steward
the Waterwyrm known as Mercury. Ere its
establishment, man and dragon fought as
bitter foes, staining the pristine waters red.

It was a pure-hearted prince whose actions
changed wise Mercury's mind, convincing her
that humankind could be a worthy partner to
the dragons, and an alliance was forged.

Mercury allowed a human city to be built atop
her seaâ€”a city she would come to love and
guard as loyally as the surrounding waters
she had watched over since antiquity.
Man is frail, while dragons mighty; thus it fell\nto her to keep them safe. Conviction of this\ncharge bubbled within Mercury's heart.
This way next, Mercury! And pick up the\npace, would you? I found a cute shop here\nlast time that I'm DYING to check out!
Ah, hold on a moment, Flamewyrm!\nAnd please stop tugging me by the arm.\nI'm still not used to these human limbs.
Oh! Right, of course. Sorry, dear.\nThat'll teach me to get swept up in the fun.
But this wouldn't be much of a date if I\nwas the only one enjoying myself, now\nwould it?
So! This time, leading you GENTLY by the\nhand... Let's be off! Work those little legs,\nnow. â™ª
Absolutely incorrigible, this one...\nHow did I ever let you talk me into this?
A few hours earlier, within the Halidom...
Oh, Meeercury! Word on the street is that\nyou took on human form the other day, and\nI simply MUST know if the rumors are true.
Hm? Oh, yes, indeed I did. It served as\nmy disguise for an undercover mission.
It's true, then! You slippery little eel of a\ndragon, you. You should have told me!
If I'd known you could transform earlier,\nI would've started planning all sorts of\nantics for us!
Girls' nights! Dates out on the town!\nThe sort of no-boys-allowed fun that's\nall the rage among humans these days!

Well, now that we know, I'm not waiting
another instant. Go ahead and make with
the transforming, dear. We've got places
to be.
Er...why? I don't see any need to take on\nhuman form at the moment.
Do you need one beyond the fact that it's\nfun? And quite handy, I'll have you know.\nI'll prove it to you. Now, come on!
Time to begin our whirlwind date, Mercury!
(I let her fast-talk me into this, thinking it\nwouldn't hurt to cut loose a bit and enjoy a\nday off together...)
(But I've so little experience working a\nhuman body, to say nothing of DATING.\nI...hope I'm not in above my horns here.)
This is itâ€”the shop I was talking about!\nThey have SO many cute little knick-knacks\nand accessories.
Yet they're sized for humans. I fear they\nare all much too small for us, Flamewyrm.
Oh, don't be such a fuddy-duddy.\nNeed I remind you that you're\nhuman-sized yourself right now?
...I suppose I am. Very well, then.\nI'll take a looâ€”ooh, what's this?
The city is emblazoned on this tiny bit of\ncloth in colorful thread. What was this\ntechnique called again?
That's embroidery, dear. They've got loom-\nwoven tapestries over there, too. Humans\nare so good with fiddly crafts like that.
If you like it, why not buy it?
But...I wouldn't even be able to\nhandle something this small without\nruining it at my normal size.
So turn human again when you want to\nadmire it. Oh, shopkeep! We'll be taking\nthis, thank you!
...I can't believe I wound up buying this.\nOr that you decided to buy one as well.
And then came all those clothes you\nbadgered me into trying on... Just what\nis your angle with all this, anyway?
It's called a date, dear. This is how they\ngo! A bit of shopping, make some happy\nmemories... It's not that deep. It's just fun.
Now, we didn't come to the top-rated\npancake cafe in town to sit around\njabbering! Let's dig in while it's hot. â™ª
But I never said I was hungry. You just\nsat down and ordered for the both of us.
I don't know if it's even POSSIBLE to finish\na portion this size, what with the veritable\nmountain of whipped cream on top!
That's a mystery to ponder once you're\ndone eating. Say ï¼‚ahhh,ï¼‚ dear!
Mmmgf?! Wha... Whah ah yu doim?!\n...Ah!
This is...heavenly! And the cream is\nso much lighter and airier than it looks.\nI can see why this place is so popular.
Right?! I thought it couldn't live up to the\nbuzz either, and yet I was just as shocked\nwhen I first gave it a whirl.
A dragon certainly COULD eat a plate of\npancakes, but at full size, it'd be hard to\nproperly taste it.
You have to be in human form to really\nenjoy it, you know? I TOLD you this life\nhad perks. Ha ha.
There's no rule that says guardian\ndragons have to sit on the sidelines\nwatching all the time. Live a little!
I...suppose you're right. I'll admit, I was\nhesitant at first, but this is quite a treat.
I doubt I would have found an appreciation\nfor embroidery OR gourmet pancakes had I\nstayed in my usual form.
There is joy even in the discovery of the\nmundane. As you say, there are some\nthings you can't see from the sidelines.
Exactly! This is absolutely the best way to\nenjoy human culture.
If you want to learn more about something,\nput away your telescope and observe it up\nclose! As close as I am with my darling. â™ª
No doubt there are many such things\nleft for me to learn.
(I had always thought that watching over\nhumansâ€”protecting themâ€”was my way of\npromoting understanding between us...)
(But it seems my view was too limited.\nPerhaps I'd lost sight of something\nimportant along the way.)
I think I'd like to stay this way awhile.\nYou know, just to see what it's like.
You have my enthusiastic support! I'm so\nglad you've come around to how FUN it is.
I believe I have. This venture may even\nhelp me understand mankind better,\nas a guardian dragon.
Thank you, Flamewyrm. I'm going to try\nenjoying human culture firsthand for\na while. To learn all that I'm able!
